detailedSummary: Deployment makes websites accessible on the internet by uploading files to a web server. Web hosting services provide server space and services to store and serve websites. Static hosting is for HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files, while dynamic hosting supports server-side code and databases. Common hosting options include shared hosting (multiple sites on one server), VPS (Virtual Private Server), and cloud hosting (scalable services like Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages). Deployment typically involves: preparing files (optimizing, minifying), uploading via FTP, Git, or hosting platform interfaces, configuring domain names and DNS, and testing the live site. GitHub Pages offers free hosting for static sites. Netlify and Vercel provide easy deployment with Git integration. Domain names identify websites (like example.com), while DNS translates domain names to IP addresses. SSL certificates enable HTTPS for secure connections. Understanding deployment is essential for making websites publicly accessible and sharing work with others.
whyItMatters: Deployment is the final step in web development - understanding how to host and deploy websites is essential for making your projects accessible to the world.

assignments.title: Deploy Your First Website
assignments.description: Deploy a website to a hosting platform and make it accessible on the internet.
tasks: Prepare a website project for deployment (optimize files, check for errors)
Choose a hosting platform (GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel)
Deploy the website using Git or the platform's interface
Configure a custom domain or use the provided subdomain
Test the deployed website and document the deployment process

quizzes.question: What is the main purpose of web hosting?
options: To provide server space and services to store and serve websites
quizzes.explanation: Web hosting provides server space and services to store website files and make them accessible on the internet.

quizzes.question: GitHub Pages can only host dynamic websites with server-side code.
quizzes.explanation: False. GitHub Pages hosts static websites (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) only. It cannot run server-side code or databases.

quizzes.question: What does DNS stand for and what is its purpose?
options: Domain Name System - translates domain names to IP addresses
Data Network Service - stores website data
Dynamic Name Server - creates domain names
quizzes.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates human-readable domain names (like example.com) to IP addresses that computers use to locate servers.
